metadata.Title: CVE-2017-5332 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
The extract_group_icon_cursor_resource in wrestool/extract.c in icoutilsbefore 0.31.1 can access unallocated memory, which allows local users tocause a denial of service (process crash) and execute arbitrary code via acrafted executable.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5332` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

icoutils - 0.31.0-2+deb8u2build0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: icoutils package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.31.0-2+deb8u2build0.14.04.1').
